snippet: Peace talks between the government and rebels are imperiled by the development, bad news for a nation weary of a civil conflict that has gone on for decades.
abstract: Kidnappings of two police officers by Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia cast shadow over peace talks between rebels and government, disheartening nation weary of decades-old conflict.

byline.contributor: Susan Abad contributed reporting from Bogotá, Colombia.

lead_paragraph: Peace talks between the government and rebels are imperiled by the development, bad news for a nation weary of a civil conflict that has gone on for decades.

headline.seo: Colombia Kidnappings Cast Pall Over Talks With FARC
headline.main: Kidnappings Imperil Talks With Rebels in Colombia
headline.print_headline: Kidnappings Imperil Talks With Rebels In Colombia
